metadata.title: CVE-2016-9084 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
drivers/vfio/pci/vfio_pci_intrs.c in the Linux kernel through 4.8.11misuses the kzalloc function, which allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (integer overflow) or have unspecified other impact by leveragingaccess to a vfio PCI device file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9084` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-79-generic - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-lowlatency - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-4.4.0-79-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-79.100
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-79-generic - 4.4.0-79.100
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1057-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1057.64
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-79.100').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1057.64').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1059.63').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1018.27').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-32.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1014.14').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
